doc.after: The use of elephants to execute captives often attracted the horrified interest of European travellers and was recorded in numerous contemporary journals and accounts of life in Asia The practice was eventually suppressed by the European empires that colonised the region in the 18th and 19th centuries While primarily confined to Asia the practice was occasionally adopted by western powers such as Rome and Carthage particularly to deal with mutinous soldiers
